direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve the first or last child element, respectively, from a list of child nodes, sharing a similar control flow and implementation pattern.
Both methods involve retrieving a specific child element, either by index or by position (first or last), demonstrating similar external behaviors.
The 'lastElementChild' method depends on the list of child elements obtained from the 'children' method, indicating a strong dependency relationship.
Both methods access and manipulate the list of child elements, sharing similar resource access patterns.
The 'childNode' method can be substituted for 'lastElementChild' when the requirement is to retrieve any type of child node, not just elements.
Both methods handle cases where no child elements are found, returning null or an empty list, demonstrating similar exception handling strategies.
The 'stream' method can be used to retrieve the last element child by filtering and collecting the stream, showing a similar behavioral approach to retrieving elements.
